frameDefinitions: An Agent or Cause causes a Process or State to continue.
A Cause, animate or inanimate, causes a process, the Effect, to begin.
An Agent is performing the portion of an Activity in which there is dynamic stability. '' 'Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny continued eating his lunch.'
An Agent or Cause causes a Process or State to end.
frameExamples: The goaltenders <t>kept</t> the game going with terrific saves.
The murder of Sergei Kirov <t>set off</t> a chain of events that culminated in the Great Terror of the 1930s.
Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny <t>continued</t> eating his lunch.
Bush may <t>lift</t> sanctions on his own, despite opposition.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual who causes the <fen>Process</fen> to continue or the <fen>State</fen> to be maintained.
A <fen>Process</fen> that is maintained by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
The <fen>State</fen> that is maintained by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
An event that causes the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> to be maintained.
The time at which the <fen>Process</fen> continues.
The location at which the <fen>Process</fen> continues.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Cause</fen> initiates.
This role is for the <fen>Time</fen>  when causing to start occurs
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Effect</fen> occurs.

Duration denotes the length of <fen>Time</fen> from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
This role identifies the name of the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages.
The <fen>Agent</fen> engages in an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)
An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
A <fen>Process</fen> which is ended by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
The individual who causes the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> to end.
An event that causes the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> to end.
A <fen>State</fen> which is ended by the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> is ended.
The location where the <fen>Process</fen> or <fen>State</fen> is caused to end.
listRoleExamples: The soot in the air  kept <fex>it</fex> <fex>raining</fex> for weeks
<fex>The storm</fex> kept us in all the next day.
Few things spark <fex>the wrath of the British</fex> like food additives.
<fex>In Obscurania</fex>, the release of the movie sparked protests.
<fex>That one stone</fex>, apparently, caused the avalanche that engulfed square miles of forest.
<fex>That move</fex> ended her political career, she said in a 1994 Times Union interview.
They ended their relationship <fex>in the same coffeehouse where it started</fex>.
